review.reviewBody:
Great shoes! Ordered 1/2 size up and fit well!
Not the color I thought I was getting üòè
review.name: Love them but‚Ä¶

review.reviewBody: I love these. Super comfy and I love that they don‚Äôt have laces you just pull them on. However I ordered the olive color and it looks more grey in the online picture which I liked, but it‚Äôs more of an army green. I might exchange for the black ones.  Other than the color I love them. I usually wear a 9.5 but ordered a 10 based on other reviews and they fit great.
review.name: Love these but

review.reviewBody: I usually wear a size 9.5. I was advised to size up and I ordered a 10. Still too small. It went on my foot but across the top of my foot was super tight and my sock squished out when I pushed my foot in. I‚Äôll have to return them. Hopefully a full size up will work.
review.name: Go Up A Whole Size

review.reviewBody: Ordered the shoe a half-size larger and it was still too tight to accommodate even a thinner hiking sock. Looks nice, though, except for the permanently wrinkled tongue of the shoe. Also, the return costs $6.99 and the site doesn't generate the shipping label from the online browser (chrome or firefox). I had to login on my phone then upload it to my email, save it as a jpeg and then print the jpeg. Also, I only ordered from the site for the AAdvantage shopping credit, which was never tracked. I'm ordering a full size larger from zappos for the free returns if that size doesn't work for me.
review.name: Too tight; normally 6.5 but 7 was small

description: Buy the The North Face Amry Down Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Amry Down Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this product! Keeps me warm even in 10 degree weather
review.name: Amazing coat!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I m 5'3, weight 120. I got a size up (S). I needed a jacket/coat to replace 3 coats. One northface from 2009 and 2 eddie bauer from 2011. This is very warm especially for 30-40 degree weather.
review.name: Perfect. Red, Red/Orange

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased this jacket and ski pants from Northface and was told by the clerk it would stand up to extreme cold and mountain conditions for a professional skier. I was also told it was covered by a 2 year warranty and 60 day return policy in the event it didn't stand up to the weather. Sounded good so I bought it. Wore it once - not even to ski; just to test it out on a cold, snowy day. In less than 2 hours, the seams at the bottoms of the pants began to degrade and I was frozen. It felt like it had no wind protection whatsoever. I brought it back for a warranty claim to the Northface in Vail Village, Vail, Colorado (141 E Meadow Dr Ste 107, Vail, CO 81657), and Northface refused to accept the return, stating it doesn't stand behind its products once worn. IT DOESN'T STAND BEHIND ITS PRODUCTS ONCE WORN????????? I was shocked. This is supposed to be performance apparel for athletes. If a ski outfit can't stand up to a short hike at the base of a mountain, how could you trust it to actually ski in? Appalled Northface won't stand by its products. Certainly, I will never shop with them again if this is the case. The clerk was a young man and I am hoping he was mistaken - tried to contact corporate and they haven't responded. I'll update this if they do. This outfit hasn't even been skied in. If you are an actual athlete DO NOT BUY FROM NORTHFACE. They do not stand behind their apparel. If you just care about aesthetics, go crazy, but if you're actually hoping for athletic performance from this stuff, you'll be very disappointed.
review.name: Not Performance Apparel and NOT for Real Athletes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Amazing jacket. Fits well and keeps very warm. Typical North Face quality! Fits true to size.
review.name: Amazing jacket!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the fit true to size
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have been wearing this jacket everyday to ski in Colorado and it's so warm and comfortable.
review.name: I would buy this product in other color

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the most comfortable and warm jacket
review.name: Yes I would by this again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Like the ski pants, this jacket was snug in a medium and super sized in a large. Beautiful jacket for the right sized person.
review.name: Runs small

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The clothing provides good warmth for the winter season.
review.name: Amazing product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great jacket - super warm while still breathable. I'm between sizes and sized up - highly recommend.
review.name: New Favorite!

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Light IN Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Beautiful , lightweight, warm and functional jacket. Would love another. The synthetic fill keeps you warm when it's wet unlike down.  I take this jacket everywhere as an insulating layer. I wear it BC skiing on cold days, or have it in my pack for warmer days. It lives in my hiking pack in non-snow season as a light insulating layer. This jacket with a wind-breaker or gore-tex is all I need for day trips all year in Alaska unless it's colder than teens deg F.  Sizing: I'm 5'6"; 34" chest; 26" waist size XS with plenty of room to move.  I've taken this ice climbing once but won't do that again as the material tears easily- ice axes and even dog claws will tear it.
review.name: Favorite Jacket for BC Skiing

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Light IN Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: The Eigerjoch Lt jacket is super warm, compressible and still keeps its warmth even when it's wet.  I am 5'8, 130 lbs, and I usually buy a medium but purchased a small based on other's notes on the Mammut website.  I am glad I did because although the small fits my arm length well, it is bit large in the torso area.  The only other suggestion I would have concerning future renditions of this jacket would be that they put in a breast pocket large enough to accommodate a smartphone.
review.name: Fits large but awesome otherwise

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Light IN Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: LOVING this jacket. Softest and flexible fabric, yet durable, cozy and comfy. Sizing was perfect - SMALL purchased, which is what I typically wear as a 5'4", 130 lb woman, 32C.
review.name: Great jacket

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Light IN Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great jacket. Fits big for sizing. It packs down very small and very warm. Good for over other insulating jackets.
review.name: Warm, lightweight and packable

name: Eigerjoch Light IN Hooded Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Wanted MIPS and didn't need a 300$ helmet.  I use for road cycling 20-50 mile rides and its very comfortable and doesn't look like I'm wearing a mushroom. Very happy with the price point considering the comfort and safety features. Following the size guide and it was perfect.
review.name: Simple and Safe.

review.reviewBody:
I checked on several reviews. The first thing I looked for was my own protection and safety, second how it would fit, look and to be comfortable. And third value. 
Passed all my expectations, so I'm happy with my purchase.
I do recommend it.
review.name: Excellent choice, if safety is first...

review.reviewBody: I purchased this for my wife and she‚Äôs very pleased with the quality. She is also very happy about it‚Äôs comfort and the protection the helmet provides.
review.name: I purchased this for my

review.reviewBody: The helmet is great. But like anything you wear, the fit is what counts. In my case, the front pushes my safety glasses down and out of my nose. My previous helmet did not have this problem. Again, I do not think it is a problem with the helmet itself, but you may want to consider visiting your Local Bike Shop (LBS) to buy a helmet you can try on with your glasses, etc.
review.name: The helmet is great. But

review.reviewBody: Bought this for gravel riding and love it. Great fit exactly as measured. Snug on my head and chin but not overly tight and can adjust. Very high quality build!
review.name: Bought this for gravel riding

review.reviewBody: The fit is great, but the strap alignment is not very good. The strap keeps loosening during rides. The look is okay but seems the helmet sits pretty high on my head. I don't really like the secondary color and wish it were all black. The quality of the helmet part is excellent though as previously mentioned the strap location and use is average to poor.
review.name: Fit Great - Strap subpar

review.reviewBody: I was in a crash a week ago and my helmet saved me from serious injury. I still don‚Äôt remember parts of the incident, but without the helmet, I‚Äôm sure I would have been a lot worse off.
review.name: Saved my brain

review.reviewBody: Know smith from my snow ski days, and this helmet meets Smith‚Äôs quality. Very comfortable and stylish. For my level of riding I‚Äôm good MPIS protection. Very happy with my purchase
review.name: Super helmet for the price

review.reviewBody: Fits well and can‚Äôt even feel it‚Äôs on. Gray helmet for the price.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: I just got my helmet yesterday have not used it yet but it feels awesome. I‚Äôve always purchased very cheap helmets before. It‚Äôs so lightweight and well designed. I put it on and it‚Äôs so comfortable. I can‚Äôt wait to try it out. Will never buy a cheap one again.
review.name: Gravel Rider

description: Buy the Ortovox Carbon 280+ PFA Probe online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Carbon 280+ PFA Probe
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ortovox Carbon 280+ PFA Probe online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I initially bought an Arva Avy kit, and the probe there was awful. I was looking for a probe that had bigger tubing, cables (as opposed to thread), and a locking mechanism. This fits the bill, and I was able to snap it together quickly and easily.
review.name: So glad I got this

review.reviewBody: I work as a ski and mountaineering guide in Alaska, and while I've been lucky enough not to have deployed this probe in an emergency, I use it a lot while at work to probe out cornices on summits, crevasses at camp, and many a snow pit. It's quick to deploy with bulky gloves on, and I love the extra grip at the top. The color coordination makes it easy to quickly determine snowpack depth. I've found it to be very durable and appreciate the thick diameter. My back loves the carbon fiber material - it's great to save a few ounces when carrying a heavy pack! I've had my probe for several years and haven't had any issues with it's durability. I am a member of the Ortovox team and have been given this product to test and use.
review.name: Great Probe for Mountaineering!

name: Carbon 280+ PFA Probe

review.reviewBody: I wore this in Zermatt and it was perfect!! Absolutely loved the fit and style. I'm 5'4 and XS was perfect. Got lots of compliments!!! Such an upgrade from my old ski gear.
review.name: Love this jacket!

review.reviewBody: So Allen and stylish, but also functional! Wore this for the first time on a pretty snowy day on the slopes and I felt right at home.
review.name: A jacket for all conditions

review.reviewBody: I just got my order today and it Fit me perfectly I tried it on and I was instantly satisfied with the cute color and the instant warmness. We were about to go on a ski vacation but I didn‚Äôt have an outfit cotton luckily yeah they don‚Äôt have they gave me a great price and it came in a couple of days!! Amazing jacket and I also got the matching bib totally recommend!‚ùÑÔ∏è‚õ∑
review.name: Amazing fit!!

review.reviewBody: Great jacket for skiing.  Warm and comfortable on the slopes on East coast in New England. Gorgeous bright cheerful color that makes me easy to spot for my husband and kids on the Mountain. Bought it in Disco color. Tried 3 different half days jackets to choose 1 this season.  The Lawrence is a great all purpose ski jacket. I measure right in between the XL and 1X on company size guidelines. The fit on this is slimmer through the hip than the Aston so I had to size up to a 1X in the Lawrence to get it to fit.  I‚Äôm normally an XL in regular tops.  But XXL jackets in other ski brands were too tight so I‚Äôm excited to find a brand offering 1X and 2X sizes.  Plenty of room for layers.  Love all the features in this jacket.  I use my pass pocket and the cell phone leash regularly.  Appreciate the goggle wipe.  Zippers seem very sturdy.  The jacket zips up nice and high to cover and shield most of my lower face from cold and wind much nicer than my previous jacket from a different brand that just scratches and pokes my chin.  Length is long enough on my short 5‚Äô4 frame to cover my butt a bit on the chair lift.
review.name: Great jacket for skiing

hasVariant.description: Buy the Orage Grace Insulated Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Fits exactly how you would expect it to. I get extra 15% OFF Coupon from here: promo1024.com
review.name: Good for the price

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket thinking it would be my warmest based on the description. It is a mid-weight lined jacket. I wear a 600 weight down vest under it and it is better. Wish the arms had more insulation. If you run hot, then this might be the one for you. It does have a looser fit than most jackets I've tried, so if you are looking for a jacket that fits an curve styled body then this is the one that works on a curvy shape.  It's very forgiving in the areas that matter (hips/upper hips). I also liked the outer zippered front pocket that fits a larger cell phone. This means you don't have to unzip the main zipper to get to your phone on the lift. The location of the pass pocket is odd. It would be best to have a lower arm pocket that holds your pass for ease of electronic pass reader stations.  The hood is removable which is best for those that wear a helmet (don't need a hood) and makes it versatile. Overall, it is worth the cost, but just wish it had a warmer insulation.
review.name: Midweight Jacket for skiing

review.reviewBody: I really liked so many of the features of this jacket, from the arm zip to the double zipper from top to bottom. The jacket was warm. Unfortunately, when I skied in it I realized there were to design elements that didn?t work for me, one small and one that made me send it back. First, the pockets are at an angle that makes it awkward to just slip your hands into. I could live with that.  But here was the clincher. The neck was shallow. You know when you?re skiing and the elements are windy and cold and it?s kind of nice to tuck you chin and face behind a tall shield of the collar? The collar was too shallow, something you don?t quite pick up on in the picks or even when you try it on inside your warehouse. Shame. I had to send it back.
review.name: All good except one thing?maybe two

name: Grace Insulated Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: the chest is a dual material solid layer. to keep you warm. the remainder is of a mesh style all around. could be used in the heat absolutely. and over a shirt in the cold. cool design. fits well.
review.name: hybrid vest

review.reviewBody: This vest is all about fashion and not function. If you wan to to wear to stay warm, buy another product. This is a more form fitting/stretch vest. I use it in winter/fall PNW days with no rain when I plan on running hard/intensity where I know I will sweat. This is for high output activities to let the body heat escape. I run a few miles to a track from my house with a baselayer under the vest to stay warm. Once at the track I take the base layer off and use the vest almost like a tank top to wear while doing hard running/intervals. Upon finishing the workout I put my dry baselayer on for an easy run back to the house. That's how I use it.
review.name: Rule #1 Always Look Cool

review.reviewBody: Nice thin (which is what I wanted) vest to be used running and cross country skiing. Seems perfect for me but had to return it due to being about 2 sizes too large. I went by the size chart but it is clearly WRONG. Wanted to order in a smaller size but they are out. If ordering order a size plus smaller than the size chart says.
review.name: Runs very large

review.reviewBody: 5'9 160 pounds and I ordered a MEDIUM. I wear a medium in pretty much everything...but this was like wearing a boat! This lightweight vest is supposed to be a slim-fitting mid-layer, but I could have worn it OVER a puffy. Returned!
review.name: Sizing is off?

Another quality Black Diamond product!
Great for layering or wearing alone on a cool day. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô11 190ish, large fits great
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: If all you are looking for is sleeveless insulation, you found it. This vest has no pockets and is really nothing more than an expensive tank top.
review.name: Big nope‚Ä¶

review.reviewBody: A fairly esoteric piece that appears to be aimed at active insulation. Zippered side pockets and a light elasticed hem would be nice touches, although this is more of a purist item. Features listed on the website need some amending. Thumb loops, hood, and gussested underarm are all glaring mistakes to post on a product page.
review.name: Features Aren't Matching Up..

As it didn't look like the sizing changed at all (based on the sizing chart), I ordered the same size as my old gloves. I also measured my hands and checked the sizing chart again to make sure. Unfortunately, it looks like all of the fingers are ~0.5 inch longer than the old glove (with the index finger being most pronounced). review.reviewBody: I bought this pack a week before starting the camino de santiago. I have a bad scoliosis (s shape spine) and one shoulder blade popping out. This pack was perfect for my condition, and I put it on with great pleasure every day!
review.name: Perfect for scoliosis spine!

review.reviewBody: This is a backpack that is extremely well designed and light weight. It's perfect fitting and comfortable. Simply put, it's the best backpack I could find.
review.name: Perfect for me!

review.reviewBody:
Took this out for only a one nighter and ended up returning it. I really wanted to love it. Lightweight, held 30 pounds worth of gear, felt pretty good initially. However, I have hips. If you look at the hip belt there is a stiff piping around the hip belt. This piping began to dig into my hips. I also have very prominent collar bones and a larger chest. I have yet to find a pack that doesn‚Äôt dig into my collarbones and cause bruising, even on short trips. 
The search continues for me.
review.name: I wanted to love this.

review.reviewBody: Pack weight is low (just over 2lbs), but still supports up to 35 pounds. It also includes many well thought out extra features to make your time on the trail even easier. I love the free float hip belt. I used this for a 24 mile cross country ski overnight trip last week. I had no problems with rubbing or clothing being shifted out of place. Very comfortable!
review.name: Great lightweight overnight pack option

review.reviewBody: Picked up my pack this week after wanting to cut my base weight from my Deva 70 setup. This pack is a full 2lbs lighter but seems just as durable. My BV 450 fits in this easily both vertically and horizontally which was one of my deciding factors. The large main compartment can fit my UL quilt, Nemo tensor pad, 2 person UL tent, clothes and food for a few days. The removable brain is perfect for snacks and whatever I need during the day. It doesn‚Äôt come with a rain cover but the cinch straps make this easy to snug up and fit under your poncho. This should work out perfectly for me
review.name: Love it so far!!

name: Facet 55L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody: Wore this in 40 degree temps with a stiff 10-12 mph wind with just an Under Armour Cold Gear baselayer underneath and it kept me nice and toasty.  Did not allow the wind to get through and ventilated well on the back side.  Soft warm fleece on the inside did not make you feel bulky at all.  Sizing is true to size (XL) and sleeve length was ideal...not too long, not too short.  The back length would've been a bit long for me, however, the waist adjusters on both sides remedied that with no problems.  It has one big zippered pocket in the back that was well sufficient for my ride wallet.  Have not used in temps lower than 40, but pretty sure it will be good for temps in the low 30s with additional base layers underneath.  I liked it so much I got a second jacket in a different color.  These will be my "go-to" for winter riding.
review.name: Very Warm and Comfortable

review.reviewBody: I have bought these jackets for many years.  They are my go to running top from November through March.  I wear them with an outer insulated jacket (Tracksmith NDO) when it is -20 -- 10, with a windbreaker when it is 10-35, and by themselves when it is warmer than that.  I put them in the other closet when the temperature gets much above forty.  I have the first one I bought.  I love the full zip which allows me to adjust temperature.  Love it when I can buy them on sale.
review.name: Have bought these since the 00s.

review.reviewBody:
While the jacket is warm and comfortable, I'd advise against buying. First, only 1 rear pocket makes things very difficult. It's hard enough to get into pockets with full finger gloves, but reaching behind to unzip is nearly impossible. OK - my bad, I should have thought of that one. On the other hand, the rear pocket is extremely difficult to zip closed when holding a few things. At times, it's been necessary to take the jacket off to close the zipper. 

If these 2 issues would ever bother you, go for it! On the other hand, if you ride competitively, this jacket will slow you down.
review.name: Warm but difficult

name: Quest Amfib Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Bought these early this season and loved them until I got another lens, which is absolutely impossible to install. The original lens clicks in no problem, but that tabs at the top of the second lens will not stay in place. Watched a few videos on YouTube and many comments said the same thing. Pretty disapointed.
review.name: Lens change is impossible

review.reviewBody: Look great, fit great to tell a difference between snow and ice while wearing them
review.name: Look great, fit great to

review.reviewBody: Wish I know the lens replacement process was complete garbage before I purchased 2 replacement lenses. Very dissatisfied. Such a bad process that you can‚Äôt make mid day changes because 1) you may never get the new lenses in or 2) if you do you won‚Äôt be able to see through your finger prints. Save your money, look elsewhere.
review.name: Terrible Lens Replacement System

review.reviewBody: Great coverage, great field of view, super crisp optics.
review.name: Great coverage, great field of

review.reviewBody: These goggles fit well and function well. The service when ordering them was outstanding!
review.name: These goggles fit well and

review.reviewBody: I like the big lenses & these actually do fit with my new helmet unlike older smith helmets and googles I have had in the past. The photochromic lenses are the best for the varied light conditions a skier who travels from the midwest needs for day & night skiing.
review.name: I like the big lenses

review.reviewBody: Great fit. Love the way they look with my Smith helmet. Can see so clearly it feels like they aren‚Äôt on.
review.name: Great fit. Love the way

review.reviewBody: It would be sick if I could order some low light lenses for these, also they are smaller than I thought they would be. The glass is good quality tho
review.name: It would be sick if

review.reviewBody:
I have been using Smith goggles for a while now. I bought the Skyline and can't emphasize how disappointed I am with the how difficult the lens change is. I took the original lens out in order to switch into a low light lens that I ordered with it. However, my friend I tried for almost an hour to get either lens secure to no avail. Now the goggles are simply setting in my office unusable because the we are unable to get either lens to secure back into the frame. 

Additionally, the tacky material that Smith applies to the inside of the goggle strap to keep it from sliding on your helmet was almost liquid. It immediately left a residue on my helmet. When you put your finger on the glue it was stick to your finger and stretch out like cheese on a hot pizza. 

The only reason I'm giving these goggles a two star review is because the lens clarity and field of view are amazing. However, the goggles are practically unusable at this point.
review.name: STICK TO THE 4D MAG!!!

review.reviewBody: Silicone on goggle strap is not hardened and got stuck in my hair while trying goggles on.
review.name: Silicone on goggle strap is in my hair

name: Skyline XL ChromaPop Goggles

In love with olive color, will get them as well when they are in stock size 8. üòç

review.reviewBody: Nice fit and stylish. Good for weight training and also as casual shoes. Pink goes well with any colour clothing. Seems to be well made like the glue isn‚Äôt going to easily fall apart.
review.name: Strong glue

review.reviewBody: Vans are light weight, comfortable fit is slightly small but overall good
review.name: Great shoe

review.reviewBody: Back part of shoes is uncomfortable! Never dealt with shoes like this. Not the heel, back of foot. Skin contact with shoes is bothersome, leaves blister. Long socks can help. I might use it for riding only or give it away. Def not for walking.
review.name: Uncomfortable

review.reviewBody: These shoes are both cute and comfortable! I ordered my regular size but could have definitely gone down a 1/2 size.
review.name: LOVE!!

review.reviewBody: The design of the EXO models is amazing. I have a few different pairs and as long as there are new colors to choose from, VANS will be my go to every day.
review.name: Fabulous and comfy

description: Buy the HOKA Hopara Sandal - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Hopara Sandal - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the HOKA Hopara Sandal - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Hopara Sandal - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the HOKA Hopara Sandal - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Hopara Sandal - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the HOKA Hopara Sandal - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: My second pair, I get so many complaints on my shoes. Vwr comfortable.
review.name: I will be purchaaing again!

review.reviewBody: I have another Hoka shoe like this that I have been wearing for my walking shoe. I got this Hopara 2 because of the neural color. The mesh lining is a plus because sometimes scree gets in my other pair. I like that the back strap is adjustable. Both have good arch support and are very comfortable. It's going to be my almost exclusive shoe for my upcoming Danube River cruise. Just an additional dressier sandal for nightlife.
review.name: Another Winner

review.reviewBody: I bought these expecting to love them as I have 6 pairs of Hokas (Bondi 8, Arahi 6, Speedgoat 5) and love them... Especially after a calcaneal fracture last December 1, wearing a pair that my Ortho thinks saved me from shattering my leg. #1 issue... I wrote to Hoka abd sadly never heard anything back. Very disappointed. Then I bought these sandals at a small independent shoe store I loved, but before I could really decide if I loved them, he decided to retire and close the store. When I did start to wear them, they are HUGE. I bought my 9.5... my foot swims in these. I could never wear them because after my tripping accident I am very leery of how shoes fit. My foot easily goes back and forth and they make me afraid I will trip and fall again. I might be ok with a thick ped on, but what's the purpose of being able to get them wet if I need a sock??? So they did but go to Aruba, and even tho I kept trying them, I am super disappointed and they are pretty expensive to be stuck with and sitting in my closet. I am sad and furious... I did get my husband a pair too and he's fine with them. I have "introduced" and gotten 6-8 people wearing Hokas. I am a huge fan, but these have left a butter taste in my mouth Btw, how about you update your online quiz to determine the best models, because nothing new is in the mix. I'd love to be contacted...
review.name: Huge...sadly

review.reviewBody: At first these shoes were nice, I owned two pairs of the original Hopara prior and loved them. I was excited to try these new ones. However, these shoes quite literally fell apart in 3 months. I do use them daily for work. The original two pairs I had held up for over a year each so I am very dissapointed with the Hopara 2. I love Hoka and most of their products but these need a lot of work.
review.name: Hoka really missed the park

review.reviewBody: I suffer with plantar fasciitis and at times when am on my feet for several hours I am in a lot of pain the rest of the day. Since I began wearing these Hopara's my feet have stopped hurting at all.
review.name: I absolutely love these shoes

review.reviewBody: Have to return. I usually wear an 8.5 but my toes hit the hard front. Would have been ok in a 9.5.
review.name: Runs short and wide

review.reviewBody: My first pair of HOKA for XCARET parks. Perfect for water and hiking activities. Absolutely comfort 10/10. Wasn't sure about sizing and the sizing chart was of great help. If you're looking for vacation shoes, look no more. Even cutter in person.
review.name: Absolutely comfort

review.reviewBody: Great product for us wide feet (bunion) girlies. The only complaint I have is that tiny rocks could get in through the back Velcro area, but it was nice to be able to adjust the back so a catch 22 I guess.
review.name: I would definitely buy again

review.reviewBody: I have many pairs of HOKA shoes, and most are beyond comfortable for my 'many problemed' feet. I have severe arthritis in my big toe and heel spurs so finding a good shoe is important for my daily walks. These fit as expected, maybe a bit wide as compared to the Clifton 9 (my favorite). The problem is with how they are 'laced' with the NON stretchy bungee type cord. This cord, when your feet swell, cuts into your foot and makes for a long walk home. I've tried them several times and always come back and change my shoe. It's been way too long to return them so they are going in the give away bin. So sad they didn't work out for my feet.
review.name: Tried to like them

review.reviewBody: Good part , comfortable all day. Bad part , awkward up get on. Would like more openness around toes
review.name: I would buy again

name: Hopara Sandal - Women's

My helmet is always on the brink of sliding out of this thing. It works... but barely. Its also hard to access stuff in the backpack when the helmet is attached. description: Buy the Icebreaker BodyFit 260 1/2-Zip Tech Top - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: BodyFit 260 1/2-Zip Tech Top - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Icebreaker BodyFit 260 1/2-Zip Tech Top - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This shirt is light enough to wear during spring/autumn, yet perfect to wear to work. I sleep in mine, then wear it to work the next. Looks tailored and professional, showcases your shape, and is long enough to cya.
review.name: The Perfect Base Layer!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I already owned this top in black, so I knew that the weight is excellent for layering and staying warm, yet not looking bulky. The midnight navy color is gorgeous and I love it even more than the black. It's great that the wool doesn't get stinky because I've been wearing this almost every day since it arrived (either with the Merino 150 Siren tank or the Merino 260 Long Sleeve crewneck underneath, both also in Midnight Navy).
review.name: I can't stop wearing this top!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wife loved this item. Keeps her warm during the winter months . The zip neck is great to cool down when warm.
review.name: I would buy again

review.reviewBody: Icebreaker came through again!  Another well made wool top.  Wool is my go to for hunting and other active pursuits when it is cold outside.  Very little, to no, body odor.  This is the second one I have owned.  One warning, pay attention to drying temperature...dry on low, then take out and hang dry the rest of the way, to avoid some shrinkage. With my first shirt, I forgot and it was dried at a higher heat and shrank, but only slightly. Just dry with care and it will be a great shirt.  Pay attention to the sizing chart and measurements. I normally wear a small in a lot of clothing, but my measurements lined up with the low range of the medium size, which fits me great.
review.name: Excellent wool layer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have a half zip from the brand in the lighter 200 series. This one is thicker and warmer1 it is also much longer which was unexpected and isn't as functional for me but it is fine. I also sized up to a medium so I can wear a layer beneath it as well. Very well made; my other one has lasted a long time and I expect this one will too.
review.name: Solid addition for winter warmth

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I enjoy all my icebreaker clothes. I really like turtle necks for winter and this works but also has the zipper for cool off times. Sung fit. I have this in black and midnight navy. Wear by its self or as a base layer. L works perfect as suggested by the sizer.
review.name: Ready for winter

review.reviewBody: I wear it daily in all seasons when it is damp and cold. Very comfortable. Love the 100% wool. Easy to care for... Excellent product. I pull it on over other wool layers.
review.name: great half zip.

review.reviewBody: I've been wearing Icebreaker since they first came to the US in the early 2000's, and the sis the first time I've had an issue. I've literally worn out the majority of my pieces but this was different. Within a month it became stiff, itchy, and extremely uncomfortable. Absolutely not what I would expect from Icebreaker. Perhaps there was a fiber treatment that went wrong? Or the quality has just declined that much?
review.name: Very itchy and stiff

review.reviewBody: Wore only twice skiing and now have a tear at the seams.
review.name: Poor quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I look forward to putting on my survival essential merino wool baselayer every morning... Not to climb mountains... To enjoy every day keeping cosy... If I was a cat, I would purr! Thank you Icebreaker from Sue aged 74. PS I add another Icebreaker layer plus hat and neck warmer to walk with dog.
review.name: My Everyday Survival Essential

name: BodyFit 260 1/2-Zip Tech Top - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Though, I loved the fit the Material and the glove over all.  It was how the Gel was placed on the glove.  The Gel was more of a hard pack centered right at my Median Nerve which caused a couple of my fingers to go numb.  I road them 5-6 times, I figured I had done some hard gravel rides and figured it was that.  No, I went back to my leather no pad gloves and symptoms are now gone.
Sorry Pearl.
D

description: Buy the Thule FastRide Bike Mount online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: FastRide Bike Mount
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule FastRide Bike Mount online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought the fastride a few weeks back for my excursion to the desert for an early season warm weather break before winter to get some extra riding in. Fits perfectly on my car and allows me have much more room available for my dog and luggage and extra space. Easy to use, looks good, quiet and sturdy. Really stoked I decided to buy it.
review.name: Thule FastRide

review.reviewBody: Mix and match Thule bike Carrie‚Äôs on a roof rack means I can have one lowered in between two standing tall. Car looks like a race support vehicle now!  Bike is secure and stable.
review.name: Works perfectly for QR dropouts

review.reviewBody: This is an old concept of locking front forks that is available from multiple manufactures.  The fork clamp works well with a torque limiting ratchet.  Thule designed this to work on their multiple style bars.  For me, it was the (I think they call it) wind wing, or wing style.  Not the most robust of materials but the bike is secure.  What is missing is lock set.  Thule is asking a ridiculous amount for these cheap additions.  2 are required if you want to utilize the built in bike locking system and lock the rack itself.  I can‚Äôt imagine why you wouldn‚Äôt want these and it‚Äôs a cheap way to charge you more for something that should have been included.
review.name: Flimsy design and lacking locks

review.reviewBody:
I purchased this rack for my single bike to use with the Evo square cross bars.  I've had it approximately one month.  Just took it from Ohio to Florida and back.  My bike uses traditional front skewer.  Note that if you have a thru axel you need to purchase a different model number.
Assembly: No issues, solid directions, straight forward
Use: Bike attaches easily, the rear tire ratcheting tie down is quick and easy to use.  The front fork clamp is a nice upgrade versus the previous over-center quick release style.  As an engineer I really liked the locking integrated torque clamp for holding the front forks (see picture)  Overall, a well designed and engineered product.
review.name: Excellent Rack

review.reviewBody: I just finished over 1000 miles with my recumbent bike on top using this rack.  It is stable and secure at speed. I did remove the seat from my recumbent bike to decrease the wind resistance and turbulence for the longer, high speed portions of my trip but otherwise found the rack simple and easy to use.  One small issue was not well described in the pictures or website.  The rack is only intended for front forks with a counterbore around the dropouts.  My bike is older and lacks any counterbore.  It would be possible for the forks to move upward off the front clamp if it came even slightly loose.  I added a lashing between the frame of the bike and the rail which prevented any movement. It did add an additional step to loading and unloading the bike and an additional check to be sure the lashing stayed tight.
review.name: Solid and easy to use

review.reviewBody: I watched the video and it only shows Quick release not Thru axel
review.name: Not Thru axel

review.reviewBody: I have not seen where the ability to lock your bike while using this rack is available.  The cable has only a twist lock and that is definately not a way to secure your bike.  Unless I am missing something please let me know.
review.name: no locking core capability

review.reviewBody: Just installed after a quick 2 day shipping. Very easy to reverse the parts for left hand use, aside from the end cap which almost felt glued on. Fits the factory (rebranded Thule) crossbars on my 2021 Mazda 3 hatchback perfectly with just enough space to open my lift gate. Definitely the best bike carrier I‚Äôve seen in terms of ease of use.
review.name: Extremely intuitive and easy to use

name: FastRide Bike Mount

review.reviewBody: Have not used yet. The quality feels good. The middle black refill where the string is on both the 6L and the 10L get caught and are hard to open and close. I‚Äôm sure they will be easier to use than the 10L Camelback which is heavier.
review.name: Flip caps string could be better‚Ä¶

review.reviewBody: I used these on a backpacking trip into the Grand Canyon. 4L for a water stash on the way in, 4L in my pack and a 6K for camp. These DromLite are replacing the original dromedary backs which have lasted a couple decades. Every ounce matters going down into the Grand Canyon and these are SO light! I hope these light weight bags last as long as the original. The hanging feature is great for camp. The spout and cap work really nicely. It stays closed in my pack even with other things on top of it. The little piece used to hold the cap to the lid isn't well designed and broke on all of mine. I will cut it off next time. The red and black cord on the end isn't well attached and I found it in the dirt a couple times. MSR could secure it better at the factory with a knot which keeps it secure.
review.name: Lightweight, small when packed, highly functional

review.reviewBody: I have a 4 L and a 6 L bag. Really love how small they pack down when not carrying water. I live somewhere where I dry camp a lot so carrying water in is a necessity and these bags make it easy.
review.name: Do not hesitate to purchase!!!!!

review.reviewBody: Well made. MSR makes good stuff. And redesign continually and smartly.
review.name: Well made. MSR makes good

review.reviewBody: Durable, very well made, thoughtful features without a lot of extra, love the ability to hang it and this was designed into the product. Doesn't flavor the water.
review.name: Durable, very well made, thoughtful

review.reviewBody: I purchased this last spring for my motorcycle trip from Spring Branch, TX up to the Arctic Circle in Alaska and back. It performed flawlessly for the whole 31 days and 11,525 miles on the back of my MoskoMoto panniers. The little dispensing valve was great, as I could refill small water bottles, brush teeth, splash face and wash hands, wash/rinse dishes, mix cocktails, etc., all right from the bag holder on the back of my bike. I am very happy with the bag and always pleased with MSR products and their Customer Service Dept.
review.name: DromLite 2L water bag

review.reviewBody: Works well! Hard to dry out the inside for storage.
review.name: Works well! Hard to dry

review.reviewBody: The large-mouth closure can be tricky to screw on when full of water, but the shape and size(s) are so packable when hauling 4 days‚Äô worth of water and easy to pack into a small side when empty.
review.name: The large-mouth closure can be

review.reviewBody: I would have thought the bag and adapter would be akin to any typical resevoir but it's pretty cumbersome and doesn't fit well in a backpack
review.name: I would have thought the

review.reviewBody: Bought and used on multiday backpack. Overall worked perfectly for what we needed. Con: the elastic tie on one end is not load bearing. Pro: a full bag survived a 6 foot fall onto sharp rocks; no damage at all. The packaging could use directions or link or something with initial cleaning directions. I found them online and no plastic or strange taste at all.
review.name: Durable

review.reviewBody: Awesome sleep pad. Borrowed a used one 6 years ago and it worked for me EVERY SINGLE NIGHT for 5 months on a NOLS course in Patagonia, and we put all of our gear through the worst of it. I returned it to my friend and bought my own finally - have had it on over a dozen backpacking and camping trips over the last 5 years, still in excellent condition. It seems if they're built right, they'll work for years, so if you got a bad one like some of these reviews say, return and get a replacement - just bad luck for some folks it seems. I wouldn't call them "self inflating" as I just fill it up with breath, the foam doesn't self-expand all the way, and the stuff sack has a weird exterior flap for some purpose I've yet to discover, but judging purely on main product durability, comfort, and performance here demands 5 stars EASILY.
review.name: NOLS Patagonia and Beyond

review.reviewBody: In the picture it looks like just a regular ol thermarest.  But like the last one I bought, and distustedly dumped after my first mulit week back pack here again we have one with this stupid re-design of the valve.  What in the world do we really need that extra little gray twistie thing for?!?!  And what in the world is wrong with just leaving the valve the way it always was?  Absolutely nuts from this crap.
review.name: Gear heads, unbelievable

review.reviewBody: I replaced my old prolite with this version. The check valve feature on the inflator is a great improvement. The stuff sack was better in this version, as well.
review.name: I replaced my old prolite

review.reviewBody: I bought this a couple years and have used it on countless camping/ backpacking trips. It is moderately comfortable, not noisy. Relatively easy to blow up. However, I absolutely HATE taking it down, every time I have used it I find myself having to roll it up at least 3 times to get it small enough for the bag. Overall, I would probably not buy again just because of the stuff sack.
review.name: Terrible stuff sack

review.reviewBody: I‚Äôve had this for two or three years now and I think the actual pad is pretty good. Not super thick but easy to blow up. My problem is the stuff sac. It‚Äôs like I need laser precision every time to put it back, so every time I use it I end up angry and spend 20 minutes wasting my time putting it back. I probably should just order a different stuff sac for it, but I just don‚Äôt understand why it was designed this way. I have literally ripped seams from stretching the stuff sac over the perfectly deflated and rolled up pad. I can‚Äôt be the only one with this problem.
review.name: Great pad- awful stuff sac

review.reviewBody:
Hello eƒüer yine, i used to this pad 2 season. It is really perfect. Thanks Thermarest.

PC. But i losed its coverbag. How can I find for new one?
review.name: BEAUTIFUL PAD

review.reviewBody: I bought one 10 years ago and it recently delaminated and formed a big bubble. I contacted Cascade Designs (ThermaRest) and they sent me a new one. Thanks guys!
review.name: Awesome warranty

review.reviewBody: I have two ProLite Plus 20" x 72" x 1.5" sleeping pads that have both failed and I've been waiting for months to hear back after I submitted details to the warranty department.
review.name: Failed ProLite Plus Sleeping Pads

review.reviewBody: J'ai appr√©ci√© ce matelas en rando v√©lo 3 semaines par an pendant 3 ans, cette ann√©e le matelas s'est mis √† boursouffler au niveau de la t√™te et ensuite au reste du matelas le rendant inutilisable
review.name: long√©vit√© insuffisante du produit

review.reviewBody: My partner has had nothing but wonderful things to say about his Therm-a-Rest (which is still going strong after MANY years) so when the time came, I knew I would invest in one for myself. Unfortunately for me, I chose this one and absolutely wasted my money. Not sure if this is how they all are or I just got one from a bad run, but considering how pleased so many friends and family members are with theirs, disappointed is an understatement. When it first arrived, I was thrilled - having tested it for only about 10 mins. Big mistake. Fast forward to camping: I've used it for 3 trips this year (only one of which was within the "better sleep" guarantee window) and each one has left me more and more disappointed with the product. This past weekend it was actively leaking air...the sound woke me up several times in the middle of the night and by morning, I was in a lot of pain). New to these, I first thought it may be user error but reread all instructions and my partner confirmed correct use as well. So, we decided to do some more home testing and sure enough, even without any weight on it, the thing lost so much air overnight that I could roll it up and back into the stuff sack with ease. I would be better off sleeping on my yoga mat.
review.name: NO WAY. Shoppers beware.

review.reviewBody: These are so comfortable when you first put them on and the pockets are great but the crotch pulls down / penguin pants once you start to move around in them.

review.reviewBody: I bought XS and they fit perfectly! I‚Äôm 5‚Äô5 130lbs with muscular thighs. These tights stay up - other tights slide down because I have a small waist and muscular things win on gravity. Things stay in place are super soft and comfy. Breathable and not see-thru!!

review.reviewBody: I have many Prana leggings and they are my favorite leggings for working out and climbing. The fit, quality, and comfort level is always on par. Unfortunately, these miss the mark. The waist is very loose, the ankle cuffs are super tight, and the overall fit is not comfortable. I will be returning these.

review.reviewBody: Good on hikes, pockets on both sides are the greatest.

review.reviewBody: These are my new favorite leggings. They are high rise with the sleek side pockets that don't add bulge. I love putting my cell phone in these!
review.name: Love the pockets and High Rise

review.reviewBody: So far I love these leggings so much, but the only reason they don't get five stars is because I think they run large and the waist is too big relative to the rest. They only recently stopped slipping down constantly throughout the day because I put on some more muscle and went up a size.

review.reviewBody:
I ordered the Medium which fits well, I like how soft they are. But they fall down a tad when running which is annoying, and especially with phone in the pocket. 
For me they are better for just every day or hiking.

review.reviewBody: The biggest thing that stands out to me about these pants are their durability. I am very happy with the materials and stitch used. They are comfortable and casual and good at the crag and I am not worried about them wearing prematurely. Good range of pockets and a bit more space where you need it to get your feet up high on the rock. A good pant for everyone. I would recommend at least one pair.
review.name: Everyday comfort and a good durable climbing pant.

review.reviewBody: Durable and comfortable for rock climbing. Good range of motion in hips and knees. Pants ride high on hips which positions climbing harness over pants without bunching or rubbing on skin which is positive. Unfortunately, side pockets are positioned right under harness leg loops and makes accessing contents cumbersome. Also contents in side pockets (i.e. phone) may dig into hip on hip flexion. Finally, lack of zipper fly make urinating very cumbersome - requires untying drawstring and pulling pants down from under harness. Overall, good pants and solid build, decent abrasion resistance against abrasive rock, but positioning of pockets and lack of fly make these pants less user-friendly than I would have hoped.
Great in every way. Not something you want to get wet and have dry though while on trip.
Tough be not the toughest fabric! I climb everyday and after a few months r starting to show where. But super comfortable and strech well
review.name: Great all round pant

review.reviewBody:
Have to update my initial  recommendation since I got into climbing recently and used these for climbing and worked great. Very abrasion resistant and comfortable while climbing. Didn't notice the excess material chafing while climbing.

Had high hopes for these pants just to wear around the campsite, but the waist sags with drawstring. When I pull the waste up, the legs feel tight in the calves. No belt loops to help keep in place. There's excess fabric on the inseam that chafes my crotch, thighs and legs (worst part). I'm 6'1" medium build - purchased size 34 which is my size, but fits irregularly. Not worth it, don't buy!
review.name: Excess Material Chafes on the Inside

review.reviewBody: These pants are my new fav. Super roomy in the right places, very breathable and surprisingly tough.
review.name: Most comfy pants

review.reviewBody:
Lightweight, wind proof, water resistant, reasonably packable, but the problem is I don't want to stop wearing them. 

I found my Steve Jobs turtleneck for my adventure legs!
review.name: Mountain worthy

review.reviewBody:
I have a few issues with these pants that are pretty specific,
the material is very light and flaps around in the wind which ended up getting these uncuffed and into my bike chain which ripped them instantly,
also the waist adjustment is a little weird because if you tighten them they bulge pout at the side
Otherwise they are very comfortable and breathable
I only recommend these for hiking but as hiking exclusive pants theyre great
review.name: Very light material

review.reviewBody: The multi panel design and stretch of these pants feel like you're not wearing anything at all. I've been disappointed by many a "climbing pant" but the Massone pants are not one of them. Only thing that could make these pants better is a zippered phone pocket and easier while wearing waist adjustability.
review.name: Solid Highlining/Climbing Pants

review.reviewBody: I am very impressed with these pants. They are COMFORTABLE. They for true to size and flex with movement. The material is lightweight and durable.
review.name: Lightweight and Comfortable

name: Massone Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: The best of the best, I love the poles they are super light and easy to carry.
review.name: Stocked

review.reviewBody: Well made. segments come together perfectly. Very lightweight
review.name: Trail running at its best

review.reviewBody: Super easy to use, super light, and super strong. Great-fitting hand straps.
review.name: Wish I‚Äôd gotten these sooner!

review.reviewBody: Having run 40+ trail ultras and watching people use poles always perplexed me.  Im tackling the Telluride 40M in Aug and knew I‚Äôd need every possible oppy for this upcoming race‚Ä¶.   I ran a 50k in a technical part of Bear Mountain NY on Saturday and NOW I understand why the Leki poles are the best.  2 days later I‚Äôd normally feel like I got run over my a car and wouldn‚Äôt be able to do stairs w/o much discomfort.  The poles are a Game-Changer!  I barely feel the stress in my legs as I was able to redistribute the load from legs to shoulders/arms.  Helped significantly during the run, easy to get on and off and frankly they are so light there is no material slow down for weight.  Highly encourage anyone reading this to buy these.  Really happy with purchase and this will be standard gear for all of my high altitude/technical/hard hilly races from now on!!  CAB
review.name: 50K with my new Leki‚Äôs

review.reviewBody:
The carbon pole is brittle and can break unexpectedly - especially splitting at the connection points. I recommend Leki add a collar at the connections like their ULTRATRAIL FX.ONE pole. 

This pole is supper light, expensive, be careful with it. If new to trail running poles, start with the ULTRATRAIL FX.ONE.
review.name: Needs connection collar

review.reviewBody: superior pole w one flaw: stability with load. When indirect load, the pole is weak. ESP uneven snowpack. Pole broke just below lock
review.name: Load problem. When indirect load, the pole is weak. ESP uneven snowpack

review.reviewBody: Easy to use! They are so light that you don‚Äôt even feel them.
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: Perfect trekking poles for racing. Quick and easy to expand or collapse and reliable
review.name: Perfect racing trekking poles

review.reviewBody: Used these on my first 50k with 10,000+ feet of elevation gain. They worked wonderfully. Super lightweight and durable.
review.name: perfect for ultra races

review.reviewBody: Great poles.                                           .
review.name: Great poles.

Don't be like the dentist, brush your bikes and clean them regularly.  a clean bike is a fast bike.  

Probably faster than your legs.

review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes after three years of climbing with beginner shoes. I‚Äôm breaking into more advanced grades, and I need a more aggressive shoe to get a little extra edge. These are perfect. They‚Äôve got a super sticky & grippy toe and heal that my other shoes lacked. My feet are not slipping off holds any more. They‚Äôre breaking in better than I thought too.
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: I was looking for shoes that I could wear for longer climbing sessions, and these are perfect!! It‚Äôs a super soft shoe, and the rubber is incredibly sticky. Heels & toes are great in them!! I found the sizing to be true to what my street size is. However now that I‚Äôve climbed in them for a few sessions, I would maybe suggest sizing down half a size if you want them to still be tighter after breaking in.
review.name: IN LOVE

review.reviewBody: These shoes fit my foot the best! I‚Äôm really impressed by how sticky the rubber is! They suction to my heel and the point is so good on the toe!
review.name: The perfect climbing shoe!

review.reviewBody: I‚Äôve had my wife try on 13 different pairs of climbing shoes to find one that properly fits her foot. I got this for her as a Christmas gift, full expecting to be needing to return them, and to my surprise they actually fit perfectly. The rubber is super sticky and has helped her get a lot more confidence in her foot placement. Can‚Äôt recommend them enough!
review.name: First pair of shoes that actually fits properly

review.reviewBody: I got these shoes because I was looking for a comfortable, decently aggressive indoor bouldering shoe. I got my street shoe size, and the fit was good. The fit is unique in that the tightest part is all the way around the arch, where the shoe really hugs your foot, however, it widens at the toe instead of squeezing your toes like most bouldering slippers. In fact, the fit was my favorite part of the shoe. What I didn't love was, well, the rest. A bouldering slipper this wide should be comfy, but I found that the rubber over and around the toes was just too hard and inflexible for comfort. After about an hour of climbing, the rubber warms up and softens, but that's a long time to wait. Secondly, this is billed as a soft, sensitive modern bouldering shoe, but the sole rubber is just too thick for that. I weigh about 135 lbs, and I found it quite clunky and insensitive, and not very flexible either. I don't need it to be a Drago or anything, but a little more bend at the midsole would help. You might not have these problems if you weigh over 150 lbs like my girlfriend. Her weight helps her bend the shoe as well as feel the holds underfoot. For me, though, this shoe is underwhelming.
review.name: Decent but not amazing

review.reviewBody: Like most other people have said, I recommend going up a half size from street size unless you can deal with really tight. I wear a women‚Äôs 9 and got the 9.5 and they‚Äôre a little small, but an appropriate amount so even if they expand they‚Äôll still be the right size. Moderately aggressive, feel durable, and give me a lot more precision than the Momentums. The upper part where you insert your foot is stretchy material and has one strap so I am wondering how they‚Äôll stretch in width over time, super comfortable to slide on though. I can‚Äôt wait to use these outside to see how they hold up, they‚Äôre fantastic in the gym!
review.name: Super excited about these

review.reviewBody: These ran small for me. Per my experience consider .5 to 1 size larger than what you normally would wear. I cannot speak to the longevity of them yet, but the first few days of climbing they have lived up to their expectations. They also look cool too with a slight purple tint.
review.name: Great Shoe

review.reviewBody: Very good out of the box should be a small and quick break in period, very tight feeling but still comfortable, really great feeling heel
review.name: Favourite new shoe

review.reviewBody: softer shoe which i thoroughly enjoy would probably blow out pretty fast if you don‚Äôt have the best footwork but overall fits like a glove and is one of my favorite shoes on the market
review.name: awesome fit

name: Method S Climbing Shoe - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith Basecamp ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Best sunglasses I‚Äôve found for hiking and backpacking. Superb optics. ‚ÄúJust right‚Äù light transmission for a variety of conditions from crossing a snowfield to dappled shade. I never go into the backcountry without them.
review.name: Fantastic hiking sunglasses

review.reviewBody: The nose pad sticks to my nose and hurts when I take them off, also leaves red marks on the side of my nose. Other than that, I like the look but find myself not wearing them because of this issue.
review.name: nose pad sticks

review.reviewBody: Very nice lens quality. Coverage and fit could be a little bit better for me but you get what you pay for and these were a great deal.
review.name: Pretty nice

review.reviewBody: Sunglasses are great. Great visibility in the water in most conditions. Just wish they were a little bit wider as they squeeze the side of my head a bit too much.
review.name: Sunglasses are great. Great visibility

review.reviewBody: On my second pair of bronze mirror basecamps, the best sunnies I‚Äôve owned. Tried the opal lense but it was too dark so returned for the bronze, shoutout to Will for the help! I‚Äôve put these glasses through the wringer and the optics are second to none. Just wish the arms were a bit shorter due to my small dome! Smith rules!
review.name: Swiss army knife shades

review.reviewBody: Have been through two pairs of these. Probably the best visual quality/sun protection I've used. Not too dark, so they're useful even into evening or "bright cloudy days." Unfortunately, they scratch insanely easy. First pair and first time I wore them was on a coastal hiking trip... Day #1 they fell off and of course landed lens down. Took a huge chunk of the reflective coating off right in my line of sight. Fortunately my credit card's 90-day buyer protection refunded me the cost. I ordered the same pair again... within a couple weeks they had micro-scratches just from cleaning them with a microfiber cloth. And they fell of my head again within a couple months and landed lens side down... instantly had deep scratches in my line of sight in both eyes. I contacted Smith and they replied the lenses in the model are not repairable or replaceable. $200 for easily scratched, essentially disposable sunglasses is ridiculous. I won't buy them a 3rd time. Ray-Bans I've owned have never scratched this easily.
review.name: Lenses Scratch Very Easily

review.reviewBody:
Had a pair of these traveled to Arizona state university for a college graduation my glasses fell out of my coat pocket at the last graduation that night. 
Called and called the college lost and found never once did I get a return call back saying they would search Lost and found. Went to reorder another pair out of stock. I am waiting patiently for the Basecamp to come back in stock. Loved how they fit..
review.name: Base camp

review.reviewBody: Great fit. Super comfortable. I have a rounded head and generally need larger framed glasses, these have a good fit for rounder wider head. Previous pair was the outlier xl for comparison.
review.name: Awesome fit!

review.reviewBody:
Clarity and colour enhancements were outstanding! 
Would definitely recommend these glasses
review.name: Clarity and colour enhancements were

review.reviewBody: The sunglasses are very good! The delivery time was excellent as well.
review.name: The sunglasses are very good!

name: Basecamp ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses

description: Buy the Patagonia Stealth 10L Sling Pack online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Stealth 10L Sling Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Patagonia Stealth 10L Sling Pack online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I‚Äôm an anesthesiologist, and this bag is - BY FAR - the most versatile and wearable bag of the 10L size that I‚Äôve found in the market. I tried to fit a little too much into it and ruined a zipper. I‚Äôm buying two more today. I love this bag, I hope they offer it for years in case I need to replace it again.
review.name: Not a fly fisher

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a small-ish bag that had to fit an 11 inch tablet, small-medium sized food container, a bottle, and as a pleasant bonus - rain jacket, power bank, some cables, bike tools. I was leaning towards Topo Design Quick Pack, but then this bag caught my eye, it looks functional, stylish, the size is what I was looking for. For me, it was mentally hard to give this price for a bag, but yeah, here I‚Äôm now with the bag and Patagonia‚Äôs Lifetime Warranty. I‚Äôm not a frequent angler, but this bag will definitely be my companion for the occasion. Also, I‚Äôm really considering this bag for a day hikes. Let‚Äôs see how it goes. For now, I can recommend the sling to a friend or a stranger for the web
review.name: A bag I didn‚Äôt know I would have bought

review.reviewBody: This bag is overall constructed well and has some good points. The waterproof pocket is a nice touch, as are the magnets for holding flies. But the net holder is very poorly designed. If you have your net in there, you can't swing the bag to the front to access your gear without getting a face full of net. It's unusable. If you watch the product video from Patagonia, you'll notice there are shots of people accessing the bag, but never with a net in the holder. There's a reason! I returned this and got a different bag.
review.name: Net holder is a deal breaker

name: Stealth 10L Sling Pack

Excellent trainer overall, will work out the hi-cadence #s, might be my connection.

review.itemreviewed: Coldfront LT Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Exactly what was promised. Light, comfortable down jacket. Good layering  piece and fine on it's own. Warm down to -15c with a long sleeve shirt probably another few degrees with a sweatshirt of sweater
review.name: Coldfront LT hoodie

review.itemreviewed: Coldfront LT Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Fits really well, is very warm, and comfortable. You just have to be careful with it. It‚Äôs extremely prone to tearing/ripping. I brushed up against a locker door at work and it punched a huge hole in the outside of it. If you wear it as an insulator under a shell maybe it would do better.

review.itemreviewed: Coldfront LT Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I really like this jacket and it seems to be pretty durable. I like zipping my jackets up all the way and this jacket fits too tight around the neck in my opinion. A little extra room would be nice to allow your chin to be inside the neck collar for warmth.

review.itemreviewed: Coldfront LT Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Really warm coat. I can pack it super easy. It weighs nothing. Fit is perfect. One ofnthe best coats I've ever owned.
review.name: Really great coat.

review.itemreviewed: Coldfront LT Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great fall jacket. Essentially lived in it for 6 weeks in the woods. Easy to wear a rain jacket over. Hardly even used a sleeping bag at night, would just throw this on and sleep.
review.name: Lived in it for 6 weeks

review.itemreviewed: Coldfront LT Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was extremely impressed at how quickly I warmed up after throwing this on. We were on a weekend trip to northern Michigan and the temp dropped at night. But thankfully I had this in the backpack.
review.name: Warm and Lightweight

review.itemreviewed: Coldfront LT Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket for a backpacking trip around Europe it is exactly what I was looking for. Windy and 30-50 degree conditions kept me just write with a long sleeve base layer.
review.name: Very warm and compact jacket

review.itemreviewed: Coldfront LT Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Was afraid of the size since a lot of outdoor gear is made smaller. Great fitment! Quality is very good and the product is comfortable. Would recommend to anyone looking for a puffy jacket.
review.name: Great fit, very comfy!

review.itemreviewed: Coldfront LT Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very light weight which makes it great for people on the go! But the jacket does not sacrifice warmth!
review.name: Light weight and warm

review.itemreviewed: Coldfront LT Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I want to love this. The black version looks sharp, well fitting, warm, light, and packable. Sadly the elastic trim that retains the hood constantly rubs the skin. It irritates the front/sides of the neck when wearing the jacket with the hood down. And the same line of elastic irritates the back of the neck when the hood is down. The lip of the hood can be folded back when wearing the hood down, helping prevent the rubbing on the neck (front and back) but the fold will pop back after a few minutes. In other words you are constantly adjusting the elastic of the hood because it rubs on the front and back of the neck. It is comfortable to wear with the hood up, except I find the neck is borderline tight when fully zipped. This is my experience and thought it is worth sharing. Perhaps try it before you buy it.
review.name: Love the look and warmth. The hood is uncomfortable down.

name: Coldfront LT Down Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I freaking love the Billie coat! Pair it with the foxy bibs and we are just smashing all day!

I‚Äôm 5‚Äô6 135 and I wear a medium. I like it a little baggier so I can layer as this is just a shell. Fits my puffy and my back brace with ease! 

Some ladies make statements about the hips and chest. For those of us women who have no assets‚Ä¶ ie a chest or hips‚Ä¶ this built like rulers‚Ä¶ this has always been the bees knees for me and I‚Äôve never had any issues with fit. 

It keeps me dry. I‚Äôve ridden it in California, to Canada, to Colorado, from 55 to -10. And it‚Äôs been a beast! I love the pockets as well! The pass zipper is super clutch! 

Love this coat so much
review.name: My Go To Shell

review.reviewBody: I have skied in this jacket 4 times this season, on bluebird and stormy days, and I'm very happy with the quality. It is sturdy, windproof, and waterproof as advertised. On the days with heavy snowfall, the exterior did feel wet after a while on the ski slope (~3-hr) but I was dry and warm. I also got the Flylow Lucy but decided to keep the Billie because it feels more sturdy, and more importantly I like the Flamingo color. Good jacket so far for the sale price of $150! True to size with room for layering. I'm 5'6 120lb and got the small.
review.name: Great quality shell jacket!

review.reviewBody: I'm always a S/M on the top but this ran too small around the hips/belly.   Should have listened to the reviews.  Hoping a L will work.  Beautiful coat, though.
review.name: Returning for a Large

review.reviewBody:
I bought this in an XL, I loved it and I could zip it up however, it was extremely small in the chest area. Almost to the point where I couldn't breathe. While I loved the sleeve length that other reviews complained about this jacket is literally made for a flat chested girl.
It's on it's way to be returned. Also tight in waist and I wear a size 8 jeans.
review.name: Runs Extremely Small

review.reviewBody: High hopes for this and loved the color, but really isn?t made for women and hips! It goes straight down with NO leeway, so everything fit except for around my waist area. (I?m not even wide waisted)
review.name: Bummer

review.reviewBody: Our toughest shell for women who rip.
review.name: 2020 Billie Coat video

name: Billie Coat - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] light and versatile, the best carabiners for alpine climbing!
review.name: Light and versatile

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect size for the friends, without the problems on the nose cause' has clean-lock. the weight is perfect.
review.name: Perfects

review.reviewBody: I like to break these down and use them on extendable alpine draws. Best carabiners for trad/alpine on the market.

They're light and rack well for my standard trad cragging adventures. They feel almost as light as mini biners, but with much easier handling. 

The only reason I'd hesitate to recommend is the bent gate isn't the most conducive to easy clipping.
The nose profile on these carabiners is a little wider than I was hoping for, but it's not that big of a deal since they will primarily be used as a racking carabiner.
Best price and an awesome product!
Match the Friends cam colors nicely - except only one silver! (A full set of Friends has two silver cams.)
Good hook-free nose design. Much more elegant than the BD "hoodwire" bs. These biners are on the large end of the size spectrum for wire gates. Love the I-Beam construction for weight reduction.

name: Helium 3.0 Rack - 6-Pack

review.reviewBody: Great shoes. Very comfortable out of the box, great traction and pretty warm on a cold snowyday
review.name: Would recommend to anyone

review.reviewBody: Very good
review.name: Wow!

review.reviewBody: The shoes are quite good they have a sturdy base and are a great walking shoe. The only issue is the lacing arrangement is not as functional as it could be. You have loosen the lace release the opposite direction to the travel which makes lacing awkward and not as easy as it could be.
review.name: Good shoe unfortunate lacing arrangement

review.reviewBody: Tried on and walked around but the toe box is poorly designed and very uncomfortable. Had to return.
review.name: Look sick but feel terrible

review.reviewBody: This has been used at work since I walk back and forth between buildings and I could be on my feet for at least half a day. The issue I have is at the front top of the shoe about an inch back from the toe the rubber becomes unglued where the big toe and pinky toe are in the shoe. For the price I expect something to last longer than 9 months after it's used. The remaining part of the shoe do not have any defects.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] great fit, very stylish.  kept my wife head feeling very warm in the snow this past weekend
review.name: Love this beanie

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This hat was all that I hoped it would be! It is comfortable but didn't really seem much different than others I've owneduntil I started to shovel snow in it. It caught and held my heads lost heat extremely well, equally distributing it so I didn't feel a hot spot. The sweat band was helpful as well. Having a band instead of continuous material keeps the sweat both off of your face and won't pull it up into your hair. Looks good too. Great product all around!
review.name: Seriously Great Beanie!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This beanie is of good quality.  The Omni-Heat material really provides warmth.  However, the beanie is too short to provide much needed coverage of the ears in cold and windy weather.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very warm, nice heat lining. Best for cold situations.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I generally love Columbia products and this was a quality item but this hat should not be marketed to adults. While I do have a larger head, normally wearing a men‚Äôs L/XL hat, I ended up giving this to my girlfriend who usually wears a tight women‚Äôs S/M or a boys L/XL. This hat was so small it was snug for her. As for me, it did get over my head but nowhere close to covering my ears and I ripped a few stitches putting it on the first time so I didn‚Äôt bother trying to return it.
review.name: One Size Fits‚Ä¶ Barely Anything?

review.itemreviewed: C3 GORE Windstopper Bib Tights+ - Men's
review.reviewBody: Wore these in a couple of rides that were in the mid-30 degree F with wind.  Stayed very warm.  Good fit and true to size for me - i typically wear 32x32 pants and Medium worked fine.
review.name: Super warm

review.itemreviewed: C3 GORE Windstopper Bib Tights+ - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I get it, I'm not built like a 250 mile a week cyclist.  I'm a stocky ball of muscle (and some flab). I'm 5'6" 225lbs, so finding tights is a chore.  With my short legs, I often find that I do better buying knickers than full leg tights.  So these in an XXL, absolutely don't fit me.  I would say that it is the correct waist and thigh size, but they are cut for someone probably 10 inches taller than me.  So no knocks on the sizing, that chart is correct, they just don't work for the husky.

I want to mention 2 things.  First, notice that front zipper, that ends about your belly button?  There is no hook at the top of it.  If you've had a beer or a pizza and have any sort of normal belly, that zipper is not staying up.  Just unzips.  I don't really understand why it is there.  Second, there is a decent chamois pad in these.  It is odd, because I don't think it is thick enough to ride without a pair of padded shorts underneath, but riding with padded shorts will probably be far too thick.

These have a great weight for really cold weather, I could see hitting the freezing mark.  I'm off to see if they have a knicker version of these.
review.name: Returned, not cut for a clydesdale

name: C3 GORE Windstopper Bib Tights+ - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Mont Blanc Pro GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I haven't gotten to climb in these boots yet, but have been a great fit on my break-in hikes.  I prefer Scarpa's rock climbing shoes over other brands because they're wider, and the Mont Blancs seem to also be wide enough for my feet.  I plan to use these boots for "waterfall" ice cragging in Minnesota after renting a pair last season.  These seem to fit the Petzl Lynx crampons well as I've read online, but I won't really know until I climb in them.  I ordered a half size (EU) larger than my multi-pitch rock shoes from Scarpa.  They're the same size as my old stiff hiking boots.
review.name: Wide-ish Feet; Great Fit with Lynx
