comment:
Hello,

It sounds as though your Skylodge‚Ñ¢ 8-Person Camping Tent has not performed as intended. This is not the experience we would like you to have with one of our items. Please reach out to us via https://www.coleman.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We‚Äôre available Mon.-Fri. 9am -5pm Eastern Time. Our product specialists will be more than happy to help you.
 
Thank you and please stay safe!

Coleman Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: Bought this Coleman skylodge 8 person instant tent and was really impressed how fast you can assemble and dissamble. The problem is the quality of the seams are not that great. After using this tent second time the seems start to ripped specially on the roof side. The second issue I noticed is the lower part of the tent is not waterproof. The materials they used from the upper vs the lower part of the tent is different. Lower part is not waterproof so water penetrates inside and our stuff is getting wet on the worst part is the rainfly that can easily solved this issues is too small and it's only covering the top portion of the tent. I wish they just make the rainfly in full size tent like the other coleman version. This is only 3 months old and I want to get this replaced with a different style as this one is a fail. we have to cancel the rest of our booking on that day.
review.name: Poor design. Not waterproof!
comment:
Thank you for your feedback. We're sorry to hear about your issue.. We take quality control very seriously, and we would like to check this further. Your comments are invaluable to us, and we will take them into consideration.

For further questions or inquiries, you may also visit our contact us web form. On the Coleman website, select "contact us" from the drop-down menu after clicking the question mark logo in the top right corner, which will direct you to our contact web form.

review.reviewBody:
Used once for overnight car camping trip. 

Pro: Very roomy, able to fit two queen air mattresses with room to spare. Plenty of space for family of four. At 6'3" plenty of head room. 

Con: Material does feel a bit cheap. Completely ok at this price point. Coleman also makes a version that is easier to set up for about $350, with almost identical name. Had I realized the difference I may have bought that version instead. Setup takes about 20 mins, breakdown about 10.  Probably could get faster with time. 

Overall, happy with purchase. Don't plan to use it a ton and the price is right. I did not have rain or heavy wind to stress test it. I would buy again, may splurge for the faster to set up model though. Really like the tall space for headroom. Great for car camping. Would not use for backpacking.
review.name: Roomy

review.reviewBody: Lots of room and looks like it will be great for hot summer nights.
review.name: Great tent

review.reviewBody: I received this tent as a replacement for another instant tent but this one is the worst tent I ever used, always I trusted Coleman brand but last 2 tents have horribly failed my expectations. I am writing from the Campground where I am using this tent. Last night it rained, it was not a heavy rain but rained for couple of hours & then today morning. This tent leaked from all around not at just one or two spot, even rain fly was leaking.
review.name: Leaks from all side in rain
comment: Hello Randhir! Thank you for reaching out to us and taking the time to provide feedback on our Coleman Skylodge‚Ñ¢ 8-Person Camping Tent, Blackberry. We understand that the new replacement tent did not live up to your expectations and are sorry to hear that it leaked throughout your trip. We apologize for your negative experience with our product. We work passionately to achieve such satisfaction from our customers by continuously improving our products and services. As we are looking for ways to better our product and service, we always ensure that consumers' feedback and concerns are shared with the concerned department. Please let us know if you need further assistance; we will be happy to help. Thank you and have a great day!

review.reviewBody: Floor ripped with first time use.  So disappointing.  We spent a lot of money.  Now we have to try and patch it.
review.name: Floor ripped first time used.
comment:
Hello.

Thank you for reaching out to us and taking the time to provide feedback on our Skylodge‚Ñ¢ 8-Person Camping Tent, Blackberry. We are sorry to hear that the floor of the tent ripped on your first use. We appreciate you for bringing this concern to our attention. We apologize for your negative experience with our product. We work passionately to achieve such satisfaction from our customers by continuously improving our products and services. As we are looking for ways to better our product and service, we always ensure that consumers' feedback and concerns are shared with the concerned department.

For warranty claims, take note that your tent has a 1-year limited warranty, if you have any questions regarding the warranty or would like to obtain warranty service,  please visit Coleman website, click on the question mark logo on the upper right corner, choose contact us and you will be routed to our contact form.

Thank you and have a great day!

review.reviewBody: I would absolutely suggest this tent for any family camping trip. We fit 2 air mattresses and two sleeping bags perfectly with room for movement. Love this tent!
review.name: Great Tent, fit a family of 4!

review.reviewBody: I own 3 pairs or Aphrodite shorts and 5 pairs of Aphrodite pants. I love them. They are size small and medium. Just ordered 3 pairs of small size shorts. They fit at LEAST two sizes smaller than the 8 other pairs of Aphrodite I own and love.

review.reviewBody: I have several pairs of these shorts. The medium always fits except this time. It felt like x small.
review.name: Very disappointed

review.reviewBody: I have several pairs of Aphrodite shorts from years prior. I am a size 4/6 and size SM in the old style are a tad on the tight side, so I ordered these in M hoping to get a relaxed fit, but the M are even tighter. Also the pocket placement is very unflattering. I wish they hadn't changed the style because the old ones are my go-to shorts.
review.name: Disappointed in new style

review.reviewBody: I didn't expect such poor quality material from Patagonia for nearly $70. Felt like it came from the dollar store and wouldn't last if washed. Returned.
review.name: Cheap

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this pullover. It's soft, durable, light and looks great. I bought my fourth pair, this time in a green color. It's just as good as the previous ones. In the cold months, these are my everyday tops. Can't recommend them enough.
review.name: Amazing pullover. Fourth color buy

review.reviewBody:
This is light enough to wear with a collared shirt to the office but warm enough to layer with Patagonia micro puff jacket on 20+ degree days. I'll wear this without a coat on 40+ degree days if I'm doing more strenuous activities. It's also nice to wear indoors when it's chilly in the house because it's very soft and fits comfortably without constraining movement. It's very light especially for how warm it is.

I know a guy who was unhappy with the hardier and more technical "Better Sweater quarter zip" because it's too warm to wear indoors. He was much happier with this unfortunately named Micro D quarter zip. 

I'm 6' 2" 185 lbs and have a longer torso. The large fits great, especially the torso length.
review.name: Versatile, Nice Fit for 6' 2" long torso

review.reviewBody: I bought this a month ago and after trying it on, I realized I just didn‚Äôt like the fit. It fit well around the chest and shoulders, but was just really loose around my midsection. I ended up returning it. It probably would be better for a person who had a larger waist
review.name: Comfortable, but I didn‚Äôt like the fit

review.reviewBody:
I ordered a fleece for my son in law but chose the wrong size. 
Customer service was very helpful and he was able to exchange and now has the correct size. Thank you.
review.name: Great customer service.

review.reviewBody:
Warm, cozy and fits great! 

Im 5'11 and 175, im often between a M or L. The M fit me perfectly.
review.name: Favorite Fleece

review.reviewBody: This is a great layer to piece on top of other things.  I was kind of between sizes, but I settled on the Large after trying on both L and M.  The large fits a bit bulky by itself, but it is great as a layer on top of other things.  It's comfortable and warm, and seems to be wearing very well after multiple uses, washes, hikes, and being stuffed into a backpack.
review.name: Soft and Comfortable
comment: Landon, we are stoked that you have found this Fleece to be perfect for layering on all of your adventures!

review.reviewBody: I generally prefer Patagonia for its product quality, durability, warranty, ethical supply chain, and recycling program.  So I?m willing to pay more as compared to other options to reward Patagonia?s great corporate citizenship. I purchased a large which fits me perfectly - not too snug, not too tight with great sleeve length (6? 2? tall, 46? chest, 35? sleeve, 17? neck, 35? waist,  210 lbs).  High quality fleece with minimal pilling.  The fabric is aging nicely. Just the right thickness to take the edge off chilly evenings at the boat (55 degrees).  Perfect for layering without unnecessary bulk. Makes a great top to sleep in during chilly nights - the fabric is very soft, not constrictive.  Bought a navy color - liked it so much that I bought a grey one.  Handles machine washing with no issues (no fraying, no warping) - dries quick.  Great sweater, no regrets.
review.name: Soft, durable, great fit

review.reviewBody: I love this fleece - I have it in 3 colors. Sizing can be slightly variable. Navy and black fit great while grey is a touch snug. Great mid layer with a Synchilla jacket over it.
review.name: Favorite fleece

review.reviewBody: Very soft & comfortable. Nice fit. Bought the barn red color but returned it and got the navy blue because the "barn red" is really a brown rust color, not even close to what we expected.
review.name: Great fleece. Color description/pic wrong.

review.reviewBody: I've been cycling for more than 30 years. I've used other Shimano shoes, Specialized, Louis Garneau, Adidas and Sidi. All have pros and cons. I was looking for a DUAL BOA shoe and had been looking at these RC702's for quite some time to replace my Sidi Genius 10's after they broke in a crash, I'm just sick of paying such high prices for everything. When the price was ... ok.... I decided to purchase a pair. Unfortunately, all colors were sold out except these red ones. While not the color I would have preferred, they look great and when first trying them on, they seemed comfortable right out of the box, and I can only imagine as they break in, they'll be more comfy. The design is great, stiff carbon sole, high quality upper and the BOA fasteners are exactly what I was looking for. (Single BOA shoes just don't tighten up correctly in the needed places.) I'd definitely recommend these shoes for an average cyclist - like me.
review.name: Seem to be great shoes.

review.reviewBody: This show does seem to run slightly small and narrow but not as much as Fizik.  With few exceptions, I wear a size 46 and that is what I ordered. It does fit but I would recommend going up a half size. Going up a full size might be too much. I was able to make it work by not tightening down the lower boa lace. And being a slave of fashion, I have to add that the Crimson fade to black color is absolutely stunning.
review.name: Light and well vented

review.reviewBody: I wear a size 8.5 in regular shoes, and the size 42 fits me perfectly. The superior ventilation of these shoes makes them ideal for summer wear. The dual BOA dials provide excellent adjustability.
review.name: Superior ventilation

name: RC702 Cycling Shoe

review.reviewBody: I ordered this 2020 helmet in November of 2024 at a discount of 75% off.  It is over FOUR years old, seemed legit.  They CANCELED my order saying it was a pricing mistake.  It is still listed at 75% off when searching, but when you click on it to buy it is only 20% off.  This is ridiculous!  And, guessing illegal.  BUYER BEWARE OF THIS BAIT AND SWITCH!!!
review.name: Would love to be able to review, but...
comment: We understand your frustration with the cancellation of your order. We sent you an email on November 24th, 2024 to follow up and provide further details about the pricing error.

review.reviewBody: I have the biggest head of anyone I know. Im yet to find a ski helmet big enough, but this L/XL helmet actually fits me like a helmet should. I can even wear a hat under it. Finally. Its comfortable and seems durable.

review.reviewBody: Haven?t used it on the water yet, but just thought I?d mention that if you?re on the high end of the size chart numbers for your size the better the fit. For instance, I originally got a M/L and my head measured 22 inches exactly so I thought that would be a good fit, but it was loose and the helmet does not adjust as much as it says it does, switched for a S/M and it fits perfect.

review.reviewBody: I love this helmet, it is by far the most comfortable helmet I've ever used and at a very affordable price. The padding on the inside is crucial for wearing a helmet all day on the water.

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this jacket, it has become my new resort ski jacket. I am 50/50 resort/backcountry skier and I've always worn shells inbounds with a light puffy under and I was always freezing. I finally accepted the fact that I needed an insulated jacket for resort days and riding the chair lifts. This is the PERFECT jacket. It keeps me warm on super cold days and on not so cold days I open the vents and feel great. I also get so many compliments on it, it has a cute flared bottom. Runs true to size too which is great.

review.reviewBody:
I was looking for a light weight full face helmet for a while. I purchase the Fox Proframe and 100% trajecta, but didn?t like the lack of fine adjustment due it being based on the internal pads for sizing. Once I saw that IXS put MIPS on the TRIGGER full face, I had had to have it. I originally got the M/L due to my other helmets being that size; POC tectal and Venteal.  The M/L is much larger, so check the numerical size of your current helmet prior to purchase. I returned the M/L and got the S/M and it fits nice and snug. 

Pros:
- MIPS
- fidloc buckle
- BOA style fine adjustment 
- super light weight
- visor goes up
- understated graphics (probably more personal)

Cons:
- price
- my ears rub ever so slightly on the inside foam
- could use more padding for a comfier fit
review.name: Worth the Extra Cost

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, comfortable, easy to adjust and take on and off. I can get my Fox goggles to sit up if I raise the visor (sometimes better than others) - they do remain in my peripheral at the top, but it's not bad. I was close to the edge on sizing, but decided that the snug fit was safest and best.
review.name: Solid

name: Trigger Mips Full Face Helmet
